body:
Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving. 

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +Prolife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll 

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

body:
Categories are undergoing changes; but they were planned long before others suggested them. I don't know if offensive will last because it is subjective. I know artikekt is working on the ability for guilds to choose multiple categories.

There's no secret Discord that ark and cap participate in. I was part of the RCP discord to see what they were up to and chat with other users on Discord that I like; the drama is blown out of proportions.

Other questions, comments, concerns?
body_html:

post.title: I’d like some admin transparency and soberness right about now

body:
Yeah I have no fucking idea what's going on, who the bad guys are etc, but this whole shitstorm seems to be spiraling out of control. Lots of posters on every side also seem to be acting dishonestly and attempting to mislead people about what's really happening, which doesn't help either.

The admins really need to get this under control and communicate properly and carefully (that includes not panicking and taking poorly thought out steps that make things even worse.)

body:
I find recent actions and behavior unprofessional and beneath the needed presentation of neutrality by those that are going to be site administrators. The line has been blurred between the opinions and humor of your personal selves and status you have as admins. 

Offensive is very subjective and the only way that would be okay is if people label themselves that way like +offensivejokes however the it seems you have the intention of forcing undesirable guilds in the categories you wish and hiding them from users. 

Certain guilds of mine have not been showing up in all. Whether that has to with the categories, bugs, or being “unchecked” the lack of care for this in earnest I find to be a problem. 

I think the admins should make a clear post on what’s going on and their good intentions towards users.
body_html:
I find recent actions and behavior unprofessional and beneath the needed presentation of neutrality by those that are going to be site administrators. The line has been blurred between the opinions and humor of your personal selves and status you have as admins.

Offensive is very subjective and the only way that would be okay is if people label themselves that way like +OffensiveJokes however the it seems you have the intention of forcing undesirable guilds in the categories you wish and hiding them from users.

Certain guilds of mine have not been showing up in all. Whether that has to with the categories, bugs, or being “unchecked” the lack of care for this in earnest I find to be a problem.

I think the admins should make a clear post on what’s going on and their good intentions towards users.

parent.body:
Yeah I have no fucking idea what's going on, who the bad guys are etc, but this whole shitstorm seems to be spiraling out of control. Lots of posters on every side also seem to be acting dishonestly and attempting to mislead people about what's really happening, which doesn't help either.

The admins really need to get this under control and communicate properly and carefully (that includes not panicking and taking poorly thought out steps that make things even worse.)

post.body:
Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving. 

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +Prolife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll 

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

body: Any community, especially one that focuses on free speech, is going to have a lot of challenges. Nobody is perfect, and some people will be upset at admin decisions no matter what. I think the admins have done a really good job all things considered. I do agree though - the more transparency, the better.

Which guilds? If they have a category, they should.

parent.body:
I find recent actions and behavior unprofessional and beneath the needed presentation of neutrality by those that are going to be site administrators. The line has been blurred between the opinions and humor of your personal selves and status you have as admins. 

Offensive is very subjective and the only way that would be okay is if people label themselves that way like +offensivejokes however the it seems you have the intention of forcing undesirable guilds in the categories you wish and hiding them from users. 

Certain guilds of mine have not been showing up in all. Whether that has to with the categories, bugs, or being “unchecked” the lack of care for this in earnest I find to be a problem. 

I think the admins should make a clear post on what’s going on and their good intentions towards users.
parent.body_html:
I find recent actions and behavior unprofessional and beneath the needed presentation of neutrality by those that are going to be site administrators. The line has been blurred between the opinions and humor of your personal selves and status you have as admins.

Certain guilds of mine have not been showing up in all. Whether that has to with the categories, bugs, or being “unchecked” the lack of care for this in earnest I find to be a problem.

I think the admins should make a clear post on what’s going on and their good intentions towards users.

body:
I made a Merry Christmas post in +Christianity (religion category) and it didn’t show up so I changed it to history and because I’m not about be stopped from wishing other users from having a merry Christmas on Christmas. 

Also +ClownWorld and +maga haven’t showed at times. I believe +maga is still broken. 

I have had to abandon posting in many small guilds because they don’t show because of this change. +Christmas being one of them. +politics doesn’t even show, so have to post those in +commentary.
body_html:

I have had to abandon posting in many small guilds because they don’t show because of this change. +Christmas being one of them. +Politics doesn’t even show, so have to post those in +Commentary.

body:
Double-check if the categories you want to see are selected, and that would show the posts from the categorized guilds.

@captainmeta4 I checked again, if a list doesn't have a post matching a category at the time you check it, the checkbox won't persist. I checked "world" under news and it did not persist because there was no world content at the time.
body_html:
Double-check if the categories you want to see are selected, and that would show the posts from the categorized guilds.

@captainmeta4 I checked again, if a list doesn't have a post matching a category at the time you check it, the checkbox won't persist. I checked "world" under news and it did not persist because there was no world content at the time.

I made a Merry Christmas post in +Christianity (religion category) and it didn’t show up so I changed it to history and because I’m not about be stopped from wishing other users from having a merry Christmas on Christmas. 

Also +ClownWorld and +maga haven’t showed at times. I believe +maga is still broken. 

I have had to abandon posting in many small guilds because they don’t show because of this change. +Christmas being one of them. +politics doesn’t even show, so have to post those in +commentary.

body:
I’m on mobile the majority of the time so I’m not able to check (including right now). The side bar list isn’t available on mobile. If these new features aren’t useable they shouldn’t be pushed. Ruqqus is worse off than it was before. I think this feature is useless because Home is already a curated feed And you can block guilds. So what help is this feature? People should curate Home. 

All is All. Everything should be seen. If there were tabs to view just one category at a time I would get that though. 

If believe as admins you should actively encourage through site functionality the possibility of engaging with ideas you disagree with. Our culture is the way it is because people don’t try to get along. All these petty exiles for minor disagreements hurts discourse.

It’s just as much so I intend to keep them on their toes and accountable. I’m not anti admins, I’m anti censorship and unprofessionality. Ruqqus deserves some better clarity and officiality from the admins.

body:
We used to say if you see ‘offensive’ content that’s proof freedom of speech is working. 

I’ve said I don’t care if the admins create personal recommendations to new users as long as All is not affected. Users should be greeted understanding what Ruqqus is. A place anyone can talk as long as it’s not illegal. Which means you will see refreshing honesty, some jerks, and your freedom to post what you like.

body:
A lot of it is certain users blowing things out of proportion and long posting with a lot of untrue accusations leveled at the admins. 

Then +deuxrama picked up on it because it's a drama guild and they have only done more to rile up these people. 

The admins have been completely above board as far as I can tell. All of the screenshots taken that made any admins out to be involved in drama were taken out of context. The only thing they did that was out of line was changing +thememery category. Cap apologized for that. 

I think requiring guilds to properly categorize will go a long way to help. Drama can stay in drama guilds, racist/anti-semitic content can stay in "offensive" or whatever they decide to call that, and I can go back to posting cute animals and browsing your political guilds. 

I'm curious to hear your thoughts though.

The admins have been completely above board as far as I can tell. All of the screenshots taken that made any admins out to be involved in drama were taken out of context. The only thing they did that was out of line was changing +TheMemery category. Cap apologized for that.

I think requiring guilds to properly categorize will go a long way to help. Drama can stay in drama guilds, racist/anti-semitic content can stay in "offensive" or whatever they decide to call that, and I can go back to posting cute animals and browsing your political guilds.

I'm curious to hear your thoughts though.

parent.body:
I’m on mobile the majority of the time so I’m not able to check (including right now). The side bar list isn’t available on mobile. If these new features aren’t useable they shouldn’t be pushed. Ruqqus is worse off than it was before. I think this feature is useless because Home is already a curated feed And you can block guilds. So what help is this feature? People should curate Home. 

All is All. Everything should be seen. If there were tabs to view just one category at a time I would get that though. 

If believe as admins you should actively encourage through site functionality the possibility of engaging with ideas you disagree with. Our culture is the way it is because people don’t try to get along. All these petty exiles for minor disagreements hurts discourse.

body:
I have ran into the same issues with +democrats as well as others. I have had to tweak the categories, mostly into ones that are not even close to applicable to get posts to show at all.

 I have been pretty vocal so far in that this seems like a fix to a problem that just doesn't exist when you always sort by new. If you want categories to apply to your home view then so be it but New should show all, in the order of when the post originated.

body:
What’s been happening has been unclear because the admins didn’t deny in the comments about these drama posts. Maybe it’s clear to some people it’s fake. But for me it’s disillusioning and feels like making a fool of people. I don’t like that. I just want some better clarity on behalf of the admins to users. I’m not the only one who is confused and troubled by recent decisions. Some good will posting goes a long way. 

Offensive is subjective and I don’t think it’s right for the admins to hide content they disagree with. That’s exactly what happened with the_Donald on Reddit. It got removed from All. You couldn’t even find it unless you had the direct link. 

People can block guilds already. Hide content by words. Block users. And curate their home feed. I think that’s plenty of tools to personally hide content you disagree with. All should be merit based and show what content is truly active. I don’t like that content necessarily but I don’t think it’s right to subjectively hide them.

I’m not the only one who is confused and troubled by recent decisions. Some good will posting goes a long way.

Offensive is subjective and I don’t think it’s right for the admins to hide content they disagree with. That’s exactly what happened with the_Donald on Reddit. It got removed from All. You couldn’t even find it unless you had the direct link.

People can block guilds already. Hide content by words. Block users. And curate their home feed. I think that’s plenty of tools to personally hide content you disagree with. All should be merit based and show what content is truly active. I don’t like that content necessarily but I don’t think it’s right to subjectively hide them.

parent.body:
A lot of it is certain users blowing things out of proportion and long posting with a lot of untrue accusations leveled at the admins. 

Then +deuxrama picked up on it because it's a drama guild and they have only done more to rile up these people. 

The admins have been completely above board as far as I can tell. All of the screenshots taken that made any admins out to be involved in drama were taken out of context. The only thing they did that was out of line was changing +thememery category. Cap apologized for that. 

I think requiring guilds to properly categorize will go a long way to help. Drama can stay in drama guilds, racist/anti-semitic content can stay in "offensive" or whatever they decide to call that, and I can go back to posting cute animals and browsing your political guilds. 

I'm curious to hear your thoughts though.

 I have been pretty vocal so far in that this seems like a fix to a problem that just doesn't exist when you always sort by new. If you want categories to apply to your home view then so be it but New should show all, in the order of when the post originated.

body:
I think it was Voltaire who said, "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to get forced into the offensive category and hidden from the front page."

Seriously though, I am fine with their desire to curate the front page of this site to be as welcoming as possible to non-neonazis. But I agree they do need to make it VERY easy, like one-click away, to be able to see the whole cesspool that is the ugly underbelly of this site.

body:
Thing is some users are split between the categories so this serves both.

A lot of users want to use /all without having to sift through politics, so they use the categories feature. One unintentional hick up is that the categories in their current form leave a lot of guilds out and therefore don't show up.

If we can first fix the categories (I like madje's proposed cats), then all guilds will fit into something.

Couple that with a "select all" option and /all would be as it was before.

If all guilds on ruqqus have an appropriate category selected and "select all" on all is an option, would that work for you?
body_html:
Thing is some users are split between the categories so this serves both.

A lot of users want to use /all without having to sift through politics, so they use the categories feature. One unintentional hick up is that the categories in their current form leave a lot of guilds out and therefore don't show up.

If we can first fix the categories (I like madje's proposed cats), then all guilds will fit into something.

Couple that with a "select all" option and /all would be as it was before.

If all guilds on ruqqus have an appropriate category selected and "select all" on all is an option, would that work for you?

body:
I think it should be a second tab. 

The first should be a permanent Ruqqus unfiltered™️ All. As I believe it stands as a symbol of uncensored or manipulated content. 

This new thing should be a new All tab All Filtered. The same as what you are describing. To participate you would need to categorize your guild, but if not you won’t show up there. So those that don’t want to be filtered or categorized likely “offensive content” they can be seen in Ruqqus unfiltered and not participate. If they do pick a category they would also appear in Ruqqus Filtered. In picking a wrong category there, by opting in they could be penalized. But their content would never be hidden or censored in Ruqqus unfiltered. 

How does that sound?

Attaching a very rough concept pic:

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/l8cm/KBLL_1NyeHk)

parent.body:
Thing is some users are split between the categories so this serves both.

A lot of users want to use /all without having to sift through politics, so they use the categories feature. One unintentional hick up is that the categories in their current form leave a lot of guilds out and therefore don't show up.

If we can first fix the categories (I like madje's proposed cats), then all guilds will fit into something.

Couple that with a "select all" option and /all would be as it was before.

If all guilds on ruqqus have an appropriate category selected and "select all" on all is an option, would that work for you?

body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them. 

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think. 

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

body_html:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

body:
Aight.
  
So first off, how are ya?
  
Furthermore, what seemingly happened as per my perception is this: JosehphGoebble rule skirter extrodinaire. put on big toe over the line and the dev team were more than happy to take the opportunity.
  
The person behind JG had several accounts, more than the maximum amount of guild. This is the claim slated against him.
  
personaly, from experience, im not looking to defend JG. This is the sort of behavior i 100% expected from him. He seemingly has no respect for his enemies/opponents. 
  
So standard procedure as agreed in TOS says that if you break this rule, all alts get nuked, you main gets suspended. Your main , as written, is determined by creation date. THIS IS WHERE THE CLUSTERFUCK BEGINS.
  
JG was not the person's first account, it clearly was his most....notable one, as its the one I definitely remember. This caused problems with the guilds he was , against the rules, leading. The people with less patience and self esteem than me, saw this as an opportunity to spread their message. For the sake of sieging a banned account counts as "inactive for 30 days" . that 30 day inactivity is usually the barrier to siege. But with more than 10 positions opening suddenly, in very extremely opinionated guild.... well mankind rarely foregoes an opportunity to be a dick.
  
Now categories! from what i understand read up top on the right "ruqqus BETA" Kek and captain are still taking suggestions. You may want to give your opinion in a post, maybe tag them. There was yesterday a post by captainmeta64 where i personally left a comment.
  
What happened here was everyone used free speech as much as they could. One person stepped over the line, and a political feeding frenzy happened. This is supposed to happen. we have not seperated 2 extreme ideals. Of course they will clash.

body:
i think, we must be patient here. Look , how many people are working on ruqqus code?
  
I sure as hell cant.
  
Would I know more , i would, ruqqus to me is an instance of "do it yourself". You are never better served, than by you.
  
I agree, hell, you know what i suggest YOU, and only you do? Because , I know your name, and I know you might not be 100% unbiased , but i understand approximately what you believe. Make a third party site , who's sole goal is archiving the history of Ruqqus.
  
The best way to prevent censorship is to keep a list, of mistakes, corrections and modifications. One they cant touch. That way, you will be more apt to view patterns or behaviors. Will also having a functional archive to use as proof for future cases.

parent.body:
Aight.
  
So first off, how are ya?
  
Furthermore, what seemingly happened as per my perception is this: JosehphGoebble rule skirter extrodinaire. put on big toe over the line and the dev team were more than happy to take the opportunity.
  
The person behind JG had several accounts, more than the maximum amount of guild. This is the claim slated against him.
  
personaly, from experience, im not looking to defend JG. This is the sort of behavior i 100% expected from him. He seemingly has no respect for his enemies/opponents. 
  
So standard procedure as agreed in TOS says that if you break this rule, all alts get nuked, you main gets suspended. Your main , as written, is determined by creation date. THIS IS WHERE THE CLUSTERFUCK BEGINS.
  
JG was not the person's first account, it clearly was his most....notable one, as its the one I definitely remember. This caused problems with the guilds he was , against the rules, leading. The people with less patience and self esteem than me, saw this as an opportunity to spread their message. For the sake of sieging a banned account counts as "inactive for 30 days" . that 30 day inactivity is usually the barrier to siege. But with more than 10 positions opening suddenly, in very extremely opinionated guild.... well mankind rarely foregoes an opportunity to be a dick.
  
Now categories! from what i understand read up top on the right "ruqqus BETA" Kek and captain are still taking suggestions. You may want to give your opinion in a post, maybe tag them. There was yesterday a post by captainmeta64 where i personally left a comment.
  
What happened here was everyone used free speech as much as they could. One person stepped over the line, and a political feeding frenzy happened. This is supposed to happen. we have not seperated 2 extreme ideals. Of course they will clash.

parent.body:
i think, we must be patient here. Look , how many people are working on ruqqus code?
  
I sure as hell cant.
  
Would I know more , i would, ruqqus to me is an instance of "do it yourself". You are never better served, than by you.
  
I agree, hell, you know what i suggest YOU, and only you do? Because , I know your name, and I know you might not be 100% unbiased , but i understand approximately what you believe. Make a third party site , who's sole goal is archiving the history of Ruqqus.
  
The best way to prevent censorship is to keep a list, of mistakes, corrections and modifications. One they cant touch. That way, you will be more apt to view patterns or behaviors. Will also having a functional archive to use as proof for future cases.

parent.body:
I think it should be a second tab. 

The first should be a permanent Ruqqus unfiltered™️ All. As I believe it stands as a symbol of uncensored or manipulated content. 

This new thing should be a new All tab All Filtered. The same as what you are describing. To participate you would need to categorize your guild, but if not you won’t show up there. So those that don’t want to be filtered or categorized likely “offensive content” they can be seen in Ruqqus unfiltered and not participate. If they do pick a category they would also appear in Ruqqus Filtered. In picking a wrong category there, by opting in they could be penalized. But their content would never be hidden or censored in Ruqqus unfiltered. 

How does that sound?

Attaching a very rough concept pic:

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/l8cm/KBLL_1NyeHk)

parent.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them. 

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think. 

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

body:
That discord is just a bunch of trolls...that the admins are in on unfortunately. But the bigger issue in my opinion is admin favoritism towards certain users (including many in RCP), mainly the ones they made mods of the ruqqord, who can get away with pretty much anything with no consequences and the admins let them bypass all restrictions. There was even a planned feature to give them permissions to help administratively moderate the site, and they already have write access to the codebase.

They've done plenty of shit bans in the past and don't actually give a damn about free speech anymore. Whatever their anime discord circlejerk thinks, that's what they always side with. Looks totally nothing like DefaultMods, I know.

There was even a planned feature to give them permissions to help administratively moderate the site, and they already have write access to the codebase.

They've done plenty of shit bans in the past and don't actually give a damn about free speech anymore. Whatever their anime discord circlejerk thinks, that's what they always side with. Looks totally nothing like DefaultMods, I know.

parent.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them. 

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think. 

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

body: The admins were users of the_Donald on reddit (me too) and around the time of it getting quarantined and banned on reddit, they hung out in the dev lair of t_d discord developing not just a place for the_donald, but other topic communities. And they did it. Thus Ruqqus was born. And I hopped on board to invest time in building communities here, mostly with news and politics about Trump. I didn’t go to TD.win because I didn’t trust those mods, so I came to this frontier instead. And I liked the idea of being able to talk about things besides Trump.

parent.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them. 

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think. 

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.
parent.body_html:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current “nazi” userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they don’t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesn’t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, you’ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they don’t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Reddit’s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesn’t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They don’t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until they’ve released Vue and are better able to hide the “undesirables.”

So, if it feels like there’s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like they’re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord.

Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving. 

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +Prolife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll 

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

body: Actually no, history has shown that the majority view is often not the correct one, which is why direct democracy and mob rule doesn't work too well. The reason is that most people are sheepish, idolizing power structures and hierarchies and conforming to whatever the elites tell them; it's nature, it gives them a sense of pride and community, and it's how tribal animals cooperate on a primal level (which is why it's so hard to not jump on the bandwagon and go against what's popular). But we know how trustworthy networks of elites are, power corrupts.

post.body:
Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving. 

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +Prolife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll 

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

body: You're debating a strawman here. I did not say majority views are usually correct. I said widely accepted notions are usually correct. 51% is a majority accepted in any democracy. 51% is **not** enough to be a "widely accepted phenomenon". If you want to make a comparison to democracy, that which I define as "widely accepted" is that which is accepted by both left and right, let's say at least 80% of the population - and, like I said, it doesn't mean it's automatically right, it's just likely to be. This was evident by my usage of "it's about _all_ the people doing it". A simple 51% majority is nowhere near "all".

parent.body: Actually no, history has shown that the majority view is often not the correct one, which is why direct democracy and mob rule doesn't work too well. The reason is that most people are sheepish, idolizing power structures and hierarchies and conforming to whatever the elites tell them; it's nature, it gives them a sense of pride and community, and it's how tribal animals cooperate on a primal level (which is why it's so hard to not jump on the bandwagon and go against what's popular). But we know how trustworthy networks of elites are, power corrupts.

body:
And usually 95% of the population is like that. Until 200 years ago almost everyone considered slavery to be completely fine.

In this case, I gave an objective reason why it's an unethical practice: Pinning or otherwise distinguishing something that is not related to moderation is just a cheating mechanism so you can unfairly promote your thoughts above everyone elses'. It doesn't matter if everyone else does it or if you think that's okay or not, that's the way it is. It is a *fact* that you are using it for the purpose of evading the standard voting system and immediately giving yourself the first word. It's extremely tempting to abuse such things and give yourself an advantage, and that's why I think such few people make good mods, or any other type of ruler--you have to be *radically* dedicated to your principles and dealing fairly, or else corruption will surely result. Most people just don't worry about that sort of stuff (unless they are the victim of it), so that's why those who are tend to be a little nuts; but you can almost always trust them to be fair. Ideally though, the centralized power structure would be dismantled entirely.

People have also thought that murder is bad for thousands of years and we still think that.

I disagree with your underlying premise: that a guildmaster giving himself an advantage is unfair. It is not unfair. It is your guild, it is perfectly fair that you promote your own content, as it is your property which you shall handle as you see fit.

In this case, I gave an objective reason why it's an unethical practice: Pinning or otherwise distinguishing something that is not related to moderation is just a cheating mechanism so you can unfairly promote your thoughts above everyone elses'. It doesn't matter if everyone else does it or if you think that's okay or not, that's the way it is. It is a fact that you are using it for the purpose of evading the standard voting system and immediately giving yourself the first word. It's extremely tempting to abuse such things and give yourself an advantage, and that's why I think such few people make good mods, or any other type of ruler--you have to be radically dedicated to your principles and dealing fairly, or else corruption will surely result. Most people just don't worry about that sort of stuff (unless they are the victim of it), so that's why those who are tend to be a little nuts; but you can almost always trust them to be fair. Ideally though, the centralized power structure would be dismantled entirely.

body:
> It is your guild, it is perfectly fair that you promote your own content, as it is your property which you shall handle as you see fit.

It absolutely is unfair an that is a fact, not an opinion. Whether it's justified or not is up for debate, but be aware that saying you should impose your will on everyone just because it's your guild is the exact same logic as "go make your own subreddit". Do you genuinely care about escaping that bullshit or is it only a problem for you when you're on the receiving end of it?

Logic that I support. A guild is private property, not a democracy.

Do you genuinely care about escaping that bullshit

No, nor have I ever pretended I did. The bullshit I wanted to escape was administrator, site-wide, censorship.

post.body:
Whatever this drama is right now about a private discord server working with the admins to subvert guilds, I’d like some serious minded clarification. I don’t find this cute or funny. And I’m not happy with recent policy changes regarding categories and a new offensive category. 

I’m losing faith in your commitment to free speech, freedom of information and visibility, and allowance of dissent. 

Now is the time to get real about your commitments to users of this site in my opinion. Because this nonsense has me thinking of leaving. 

For other ruqqusers, I am the Guildmaster of +News +ClownWorld +Conspiracy +Commentary +Conservatives +MAGA +Christianity +Prolife +Comedy and +WhereWeGo1WeGoAll 

And I have been here since Ruqqus was a quiet sleepy little town of a few active users.

body:
Because I guarantee you would do it as an admin too; indeed, you are defending an administrative action of it right now! And I'm sure based on your response to reddit admins you'd complain about mod abuse in another subreddit or guild too. You don't like being oppressed and that's completely understandable. Yet when *you* do it to other people that's fine, just as long as it isn't hurting you!

I could tell by your attitude, and then I remembered that this argument had indeed started about an admin action. If you want any of these problems to be solved you have to give up some of your selfishness and not engage in it yourself, or else you're just helping fuel the flames.

body:
You don't know me, and it is a display of sheer presumption for you to make such a statement.

I continue to defend the action. We're talking about categorising, not silencing. In case you don't know or don't remember, I opposed making political content hidden by default... however, someone who does go to the options and disables offensive content should be able to do so and have all, or at least most, offensive content filtered out.

Feel free to continue to attack this strawman of "it's only a problem when others do it". I've not said that or anything similar.

No, of course I wouldn't pin my posts as an admin just to make my opinion stand out above the others'... the admins have a duty to be impartial, guildmasters do not.

body: Didn't know Ruqqus is related to the original T_D sub. With the Trump loss and Voat shutdown, I think it makes sense now. People who are making things happen behind the scene doing things to disperse Trump supporters. Ruqqus' traffic has be going down, with the new rules of labeling guilds, it'll probably drop the traffic even more. Oh well, this is why I'm on a few other Reddit alternative sites, let's see if any of them can survive.

parent.body: The admins were users of the_Donald on reddit (me too) and around the time of it getting quarantined and banned on reddit, they hung out in the dev lair of t_d discord developing not just a place for the_donald, but other topic communities. And they did it. Thus Ruqqus was born. And I hopped on board to invest time in building communities here, mostly with news and politics about Trump. I didn’t go to TD.win because I didn’t trust those mods, so I came to this frontier instead. And I liked the idea of being able to talk about things besides Trump.

body:
No, governments do not have an obligation to be impartial. They have an obligation not to be partial to their own interests, but the interests of the people. However, within the people, they do and should prioritise their own supporters (which is why centre-right parties implement measures that favour the middle class while far left parties (supposedly) implement measures that favour the lower class). Whether that can be considered "impartial" is up to each person's interpretation.

In either case, even if we do accept that governments have to be impartial, the "government" here are the administrators, not the guildmasters. The guildmasters are more like landlords, which do what they want on their own property.
body_html:
No, governments do not have an obligation to be impartial. They have an obligation not to be partial to their own interests, but the interests of the people. However, within the people, they do and should prioritise their own supporters (which is why centre-right parties implement measures that favour the middle class while far left parties (supposedly) implement measures that favour the lower class). Whether that can be considered "impartial" is up to each person's interpretation.

In either case, even if we do accept that governments have to be impartial, the "government" here are the administrators, not the guildmasters. The guildmasters are more like landlords, which do what they want on their own property.

parent.body:
No, governments do not have an obligation to be impartial. They have an obligation not to be partial to their own interests, but the interests of the people. However, within the people, they do and should prioritise their own supporters (which is why centre-right parties implement measures that favour the middle class while far left parties (supposedly) implement measures that favour the lower class). Whether that can be considered "impartial" is up to each person's interpretation.

In either case, even if we do accept that governments have to be impartial, the "government" here are the administrators, not the guildmasters. The guildmasters are more like landlords, which do what they want on their own property.

body:
> Let me guess, you're an authoritarian right?

Depends on the point of reference. I'm definitely not as authoritarian as _some people_ you find on this website.

I don't know where you got the impression that this was my argument, but you're arguing with a strawman. It's not that it's morally right, it's just that there's nothing to make it morally wrong.
